Community Hub
It came from space, and ate our brains
‘It came from space, and ate our brains’ is an Arcade top down shooter with horde survival gameplay. The brain slurping aliens are only vulnerable to bullets. Using your flashlight, environment and special powers you have a better chance to take care of the unwanted pink guests.
User reviews: Very Positive (187 reviews) - 91% of the 187 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Mar 19, 2015

Recent updates View all (25)

November 4

Patch 1.3.1 - Splitscreen and items!

After an awesome and successful beta of the splitscreen mode we have published an update on Steam that includes this feature, and more , for the world to enjoy! The following features are now available in ‘ It came from space, and ate our brains ’:

Splitscreen
Thanks to all the feedback from our testers we have optimized the splitscreen mode, a mode that allows you to play with up to four players from your comfy couch! Killing aliens and protecting your brain is now even more awesome!

Simply start up a game, get your friends to pick up their controller and with the press of a button they can join the alien slaying carnage!



Purchase support items!
No longer do you have to depend on just the S.W.A.T. drone to drop items that you need to survive. Once you have scavenged enough coins during a game you can now simply purchase the items that you need from a new purchase window! Purchase an additional medkit, make your last stand with a dozen turrets or fight your way out by purchasing a shield! We’ll leave it up to you to see how far you will go to protect your brain.



Increased performance and stability
The game now runs smoother than ever before! We’ve made a lot of fixes that increased the performance and stability of the game!

You can follow the development of the game and other news on our social media channels:
Twitter
Facebook
YouTube
Official website

4 comments Read more

October 12

Splitscreen mode is now available for testing!

A while ago, we posted an update announcing that the split-screen mode would be making its way to It came from space, and ate our brains .

Today, we are excited to announce that the local split-screen mode is entering BETA-mode, allowing everyone that has purchased the game to help us test this new feature!

How can I enter the local split-screen BETA?

- First, go to your Games Library. ‘Right Click’ on It came from space, and ate our brains and select: ‘Properties’
- Go to the ‘BETAs’ tab, where you need to enter an activation-key for the BETA. Enter the following code in the field to unlock the BETA: ''splitscreenbeta'' and make sure to click ‘Check Code’.
- After you have completed step 2, go to the drop-down menu and select the ‘closed_beta’ to unlock the splitscreen mode!

Thank you so much for participating in the Beta! The update will install and you will be able to enjoy local split-screen! In case the update doesn’t start straight away, make sure to restart your Steam client.

Please use this thread on the community hub to post your feedback for the local split-screen mode! We are eager to hear how everything works and if you enjoy playing it with your buddies!

You can follow the development of the game and other news on our social media channels:
Twitter
Facebook
YouTube
Official website


2 comments Read more

About 'It came from space, and ate our brains'


In It came from space, and ate our brains you play as a dude who survived an alien invasion... For now ... Nasty pink aliens invaded planet Earth to collect every available human brain. Why? Just because .

In this top-down action packed horror survival game you need to defend yourself ( and your friends ) and make sure you can fend off the aliens, who will use all of their unique abilities to bring you down! They jump, dodge, charge, swing and sneak up to you, just so they can enjoy the taste of your brain. Use your flashlight, defensive items and awesome weapons to protect yourself and set a highscore on the global leaderboards!

When playing the game you will feel hunted, scream from time to time and get annoyed because you didn't see an alien sneaking up to you! Are you a survivor? Or do you crawl up in a corner and let the aliens harvest your brain?



Key features of ' It came from space, and ate our brains :

  • Play alone, or with with up to 4 friends in online co-op!
  • Easy to learn, hard to get these *#$% aliens off my back!
  • Visit different locations ranging from cities, forests and alien spaceships.
  • Make use of turrets, shields, mines and other items to protect your brain.
  • Unique upgradeable weapons to wreck havoc and teach these aliens a lesson! #rekt

And the best Steam features:
  • Controller support: slay nasty aliens while relaxing on the couch with a controller.
  • Steam Trading Cards: collect badges, backgrounds and emoticons.
  • Steam Achievements: Prove to the rest of the world that aliens are no match for you!

More reasons to purchase 'It came from space, and ate our brains'

About This Game

‘It came from space, and ate our brains’ is an Arcade top down shooter with horde survival gameplay in a unique atmospheric setting with addicting gameplay elements, which all can be played cooperatively.

You are a no-nonsense kind of guy equipped with a flashlight and a weapon. You somehow managed to survive the invasion of a merciless alien species, the kind that feeds on human brains. Things look bad when you wander the city and other locations, there is chaos everywhere! You are looking for gear and weapons to survive, as pink light emitting aliens try to corner you and eat your brain. You realize there is only one thing left to do: set a new high score and die like a badass.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: Intel® Core™ 2 Duo / AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 3800+
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® 6800 GT @ 512MB / ATI® Radeon™ X1900XT @ 512MB or better
    • DirectX: Version 10
    • Hard Drive: 1 GB available space
    • Sound Card: DirectX® Compatible Sound Card

55 of 68 people (81%) found this review helpful
6

1 person found this review funny
Lindion45
81 products in account
18 reviews
Recommended
13.4 hrs on record
Posted: May 12
Got this game for free
However that does not affect the tone of my review. This is a review for v1.1.4.1

The good!
  • Very smooth. The controls, the animations, the effects, everything is just so fluid and perfect. It's incredibly satisfying shooting hordes of enemies, unlike some games!
  • Exciting and rewarding gameplay. Once the waves start getting harder, the intensity racks up. Losing a life brings an intense regretful feeling, which just shows how immersive it truly is.
  • Unusual graphics. I really like the unique graphic style. It's minimal and monotone, yet it doesn't seem to get boring. That could simply be due to the variety of the maps, but either way it feels very balanced and in no way repetitive!
  • Lots to do! You won't run out of gameplay any time soon. There are 12 maps to unlock, and each one has 4 difficulties. There are a comfortable spread of achievements, and of course trading cards to unlock too!
  • Great little details! For instance the GUI is clear and well designed, whilst the kickback camera shake for firing weapons is a very nice touch too.
  • Crisp HD sound effects. If the visuals weren't enough for you, they're accompanied by a luscious sound effect for each weapon and event!
  • Seeing friend's scores is motivating. Just before I go into a level, I am presented with the top scores from my friends. This obviously gives me a drive to get a better score than them, hence making me want to play more!
  • Large maps. Each of the 12 maps have clearly had some thought put into them. There are choke points, open spaces, and passageways to explore whilst fending off the crowds of enemies!
  • Alien variation is sound. Each alien is unique, and not just cannon fodder! You genuinely have to prioritise your shooting order, because some are more dangerous. For instance that god damn frog alien that is accountable for 99% of my deaths.

And then the bad
  • Multiplayer is not optimised . I experienced constant step lag for both the players and monsters, when I played with my friend. I have a very fast connection too, but it rendered multiplayer basically unplayable, because in 1 second of lag, you've lost a life. And you only have 3! Until this has been fixed, I would not recommend multiplayer unless the people you intend to play with have very fast connections! There are also bugs here and there, related to joining.
  • Score is calculated on multiplier. I personally think that this is bad, because it means you have to round up all the enemies into a group, and then mass slaughter them together to get the combo. I would much rather it be based around accuracy, like how many times you can shoot and not miss. I feel that this would be more rewarding, and also encourage not spraying of bullets, as you do have unlimited.
  • Interest is lost upon death. I can only usually play one match per sitting, because dying is such a large loss, and takes so long to progress. Each life usually takes 20-45 minutes for me, so when I die, I really can't be bothered to pick it up again.
  • The massive enemies are pointless. As the result of them being so slow, I can just run around in circles and pick them off. They also have a tendency to ruin a combo, because they take so long to kill.
  • Extreme level pacing. The other difficulties are not paced very well in my opinion. All they do, is bump up the speed and quantity of aliens vastly. This just basically turns the game into a carnage, meaning it's difficult to survive more than 30 seconds. This is artificial difficulty, and is in no way rewarding to play!
  • All guns are powerful. At max level, all the guns are OP. This basically means that the cheapest upgrade route is the best! I haven't really needed to experiment with the other options, because they are too expensive! Also side note, it sometimes does not notify you when an upgrade is available!
  • No tutorial! This one isn't really too much of an issue, because it's pretty obvious what you have to do, but on the first play, I had no idea you could upgrade your weapons!
  • When you die, that's it. There is no experience or coins unlocked to spend out of game. If you fail a round, you essentially wasted your time!
  • Framerate issues . I find that it lags unbearably on the main menus, when I'm on the highest graphics settings. Even during gameplay, I sometimes get FPS spikes. However this is only usually in multiplayer. I only mention this because I use a gaming rig, and in theory this should not be a CPU intensive game!
  • Only one game mode! This is a missed opportunity for sure! Team deathmatch, campaign, endless mode? Where are they?!

Summary
    Despite it's flaws, I always seem to pick it back up again, as it's a great timewaster in small installments! If you've got half an hour to kill, I'd definitely recommend this game. But the multiplayer is only truly fun if you and your friends have a good internet connection.

Recommended price: as is

Sweet top down survival shooter where you’re tasked to eradicate as many pinko extraterrestrials as you can before they eat your brains.

That’s the gist of it, lots of fun to be had here and it even as a co-op online mode so… recommended to genre fans and if cheap enough, to anyone that likes shooting stuff.

Recommended

Posted: July 5
Solid twin stick style run & gun with a voxel aesthetic.

Pros:
+Solid core gameplay
+Variety of weapons
+Music
+Large maps

Cons:
-Voxel aesthetic (for me, anyway)
-Dark/spooky lighting can make it hard to see
-No real progression, other than stage unlocks

Untested:
Multiplayer - the potential is there, but I've not tested it out with friends as of yet.

Recommended
31.0 hrs on record
Posted: October 20
This is one of those games where you grab a friend and run around frantically trying to stay alive as waves of aliens come flooding towards you. The best way to live is to grab random upgrade boxes that will give you money, health, survival abilities, or special attack options. Money can be spent to upgrade your weapons to make you a killing machine.

I have a blast playing this because it is fun, it is hard, it's simple, and it's well done. I recommend that you play with friends and try to beat all the levels.

Excruciate
681 products in account
573 reviews
Not Recommended
5.3 hrs on record
Posted: September 4
Looks great and plays great but it might be the most repetitive game ever made. There are basically what feels like only 2 or 3 different enemy types because they are all similar in design and color: pink. What you do on the first level is the exact same process on every other level: kill-kite a ton of pink monsters, upgrade your gun a few times, repeat on next stage. There is zero variety, zero depth, and not much fun beyond the first stage or two. What you do in the first five minutes is identical to every future minute you could possibly put into the game. Each stage is just a different layout for you to repeat exactly what you just did over, and over, and over again.

On the game's title screen the fat guy saying "I can assure you this game does not suck" is not funny because it isn't really true. He should watch what he says in the future especially if it is going to be plastered all over the title screen of a game with next to no depth whatsoever and is more repetitive and lacking in more detail, choice, variety, and overall substance (none beyond the first stage) than just about any top-down shooter I have ever seen.

Don't state something that the game simply cannot prove.

5.5/10
